info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 5 at 5:45AM EDT until April 7 at 6:37AM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Louisville KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky...
Salt River at Shepherdsville affecting Bullitt County.
.Heavy rain from the past few days has caused the river to rise.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Salt River at Shepherdsville.
* WHEN...From this evening to Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 32.0 feet, Water covers low spot of KY 61 at north end of bridge. At 33.0 feet, Corner of First and Buckman Street north of bridge flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 30.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 29.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 33.8 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.1 feet on 04/28/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by early this afternoon.this afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO MONDAY MORNING
